storyInfo: The Doctor tries to develop new Oripathy medicine through self-experiments. Theresa senses the internal conflict in the Doctor's mind.

attributes.content: A piece of Originium crystal lies quietly on the test table, glowing orange-yellow under the light.
It looks pure, beautiful, harmless.
Priestess... What have we done...?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'm afraid not. It's impossible.
attributes.name: Savage

attributes.content: Doctor... it hurts...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Thank... you...
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: The Doctor picks up the Originium crystal with one hand and stabs it into the other arm.
It leaves a bloody gash on the arm, but nothing else.
The pain grows distinct.
Yet it is not the pain of Originium infection.
The instruments show the same: There is no sign of assimilation of Originium and cell.
...Originium won't infect me.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Did we ever imagine that such pain would come?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: What would you say about what's happening to this world?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Originium.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) The last spark that we have passed on.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Steady breathing)
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's working.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It's several times more effective than existing suppressants. Amiya's blood Originium crystal concentration has dropped significantly.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's just a prototype. I haven't found a way to mass-produce it on Terra yet.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know you're experimenting on yourself... but you really don't look well.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Just some research on blood.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Originium doesn't infect me. We've had safety measures in place since it was just an energy project. Maybe this could be used to mitigate the symptoms of Oripathy.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And Theresa... she's not like you. Civilight Eterna is not some kind of powerful magic. She has simply created Originium Arts in its most fundamental form, through the accumulation of a long legacy.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: With her help, we may be able to develop more advanced Oripathy medicine that can be mass produced...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'm more concerned about you right now, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm fine.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: If Originium has transformed you into beings identical to us, then there will be a way to create a serum in place of my own...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No matter how complicated the present issues are, if Babel can develop an effective Oripathy medicine...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It will be more than just the Sarkaz that support us. It will be all of Terra.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Then, we can—
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.text: <color=#000000>Foster a future with Originium, one that is peaceful, happy, and eternal.</color>

attributes.content: No, listen to me.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit grabs the Doctor's arm.
It is a lot thinner than she remembers.
You have not relaxed for an instant, from Rim Billiton, to the Sarkaz civil war.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I chose to wake you up in order to point the way for this civilization, one that's surprised me at every turn.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I don't want you to waste away now.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You need to take care of yourself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Sorry.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Right now, though, what I want to do most is alleviate Amiya's pain.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Three months later...
Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
I see you, Amiya. You can come out.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor... am I interrupting anything?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No, just curious how you got in when I didn't hear the door open.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I found a lot of secret passages.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Secret passages?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Yeah. Closure said not to tell anyone, so I haven't.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No wonder Dr. Kal'tsit can't find you for checkups. You've been hiding there all along.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...I promise I won't run away, if you go with me.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Alright, I'll try to make the time.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You've been really busy. Dr. Kal'tsit said even she has hardly seen you lately.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Whenever I see you, you're all by yourself, carrying a stack of papers, head down, walking from one end of a corridor to the other.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If someone says hi to you, all you do is nod, then keep on walking without a word.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Sounds like you're describing a really rude person. Sorry, Amiya.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No, that's not what I meant... you just seem really unhappy.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Why would you say that?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Before we came to Rhodes Island, you were curious about everything, cuddled up with the burdenbeasts at night, crouched down to look at tiny rocks in the mines, and went to pick fruit from beckbeast dens...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You enjoyed everything, even the things that didn't interest me as a kid.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But now... whenever I talk to you about something fun, all you say is, 'I'm glad you enjoyed it, Amiya.'
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But I came to talk to you about it to make you feel happy...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Are you unhappy because I'm not getting better?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's not because of you, Amiya. This is about me.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And... you can hear noises outside the ship, can't you?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Yes. Like the huge drills in Rim Billiton. They're so noisy... I don't like them.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Me, Theresa, Dr. Kal'tsit, we all have a lot of things to do. It's not your fault.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Do you have time today, Amiya?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Yes!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I want to go up the deck and see the clouds. It's going to rain. They have very interesting shapes, and I could talk for a long time if there was someone there to listen to me.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Of course! But... don't you have work to do?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's okay... I'll be done soon.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.text: Amiya.
If there comes a day when we cure Oripathy, not just for you but for all of Terra as well...
When the day comes that Terrans no longer live in fear of Originium and Catastrophe...
Let's go on a journey again, to see the rest of this great land.
This time, we'll bring Kal'tsit, and...
Originium will become the light that guides the next civilization.
<color=#000000>All consciousness shall foster new hope in Originium, until the end of time.</color>

attributes.content: Doctor!
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...It's okay. The Doctor just passed out on the deck due to exhaustion.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Thank goodness... it's not something serious.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What about the wound on the Doctor's arm?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Trying to contract Oripathy. The Doctor tried many ways: breathing in dust, exposure to Originium-dense environments, even a direct incision with active Originium...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I tried to get the Doctor to stop, and I asked Scout to do the same, but...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No one wants to see the Doctor get hurt.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Maybe the Doctor is in more pain than we see on the surface.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What about Amiya?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Terribly frightened. She wouldn't stop crying. It took a lot of effort to get her to sleep.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This is... a sculpture?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A gift from a rescued Infected to the Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ace was the first to hear Amiya's cry. He carried the Doctor back and left this behind.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: See, Doctor? You've established connections with so many people. You're not alone.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But what are you hiding that you wouldn't even tell Kal'tsit or me?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Doctor's truly wants to help Amiya and Babel. I can feel that.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But I also can't help but feel that the Doctor leaves some thoughts unsaid... some concerns, some doubts.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I believed these sentiments were the result of such an abrupt awakening, and that they would go away in time.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But they haven't.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Doctor is being torn apart by these unsaid things, tormented by hesitation, pain, and guilt.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Perhaps I don't understand the Doctor as well as I thought.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I don't know how to ease the Doctor's pain. And if neither of us know what the Doctor is thinking...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then the Doctor of Babel will always be alone, all the love and respect notwithstanding.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I will explain to the Doctor in time.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Theresa puts her hand on the Doctor's forehead.
Under the warm surface lies a past that she cannot fathom.
Civilight Eterna.

attributes.text: <color=#000000>Originium must rewrite all.</color>
<color=#000000>Only then is there value in existence.</color>
From the emergence of intelligent life, to the lights in the cosmos and the maelstrom of the stars.
Originium will continue to replicate and transform, until even time ceases to exist.

attributes.content: This... is Originium?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.text: Originium.
The first light before the Big Bang.
She said that only by covering every inch of the land in Originium, only by returning matter and time, tide and wonder, light and wailing, to the vast ocean of information...
Only then will we find change and advancement, and avert the fate that is the end.
Even though...
It is not a transformation, but a death.
<color=#000000>It is not an extinction, but a continuation.</color>

attributes.content: When was this memory...? The Doctor's emotion, pain, hesitation, and... fear?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Who was that... accompanying the Doctor in despair?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No, Kal'tsit said there was another—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The growth of Originium is silent, beautiful, calm.
All signs of life have been overgrown, civilization has vanished from this land.
But Theresa feels only fear and suffocation.
The memory is trembling, collapsing. There is a force somewhere, trying to fix an error.
The Originium in the memory continues to grow, even assimilating Theresa's consciousness—
'Theresa...'
Kal'tsit? Oh, yes, she was by my side.
'Theresa!'
She seems to see the Doctor, before her consciousness is fully absorbed by the nebulous Originium light—
Theresa!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What happened, Theresa?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What did you see?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I... I saw Originium.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It had assimilated the entire continent. The Doctor felt pain and anxiety over it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Was that the Doctor's memory? No... a dream?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Give me a hand, Kal'tsit. The feeling, the noise and the wailing... I...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I told you that Originium once decided the distant future of this land. There were two choices.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We were too focused on tangible suffering, Catastrophe, Oripathy. Casting our eyes toward that future brought too much difficulty and too little meaning.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Doctor chose one of them... the future that the Doctor spoke of to me, personally.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I could not forget that future the Doctor described. Never, in all these years.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But the other cold and empty thought has often shot up my spine in the middle of the night over the past ten thousand years.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I cannot speak of it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But you can sense my anger with your power.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That means that Civilight Eterna exists outside of the boundaries of language.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So, Theresa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you saw a future that you are not willing to accept, I hope you, Civilight Eterna, can change the course. Only you can.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you saw the side of myself or the Doctor that is strange to you...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No, Kal'tsit, that's not what I meant—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: —The Doctor's feelings toward Amiya, toward us, toward you, are sincere. That is the truth.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Trust the Doctor, and trust me. I will find the answer to what is tormenting the Doctor. And when—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor!
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor... you're awake.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What happened to me?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You fainted as you were leaving the deck with Amiya.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hgnh... where's Amiya?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: A little shaken, but she's fine.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You're still in bad shape. What were you thinking?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.text: <color=#000000>I want to cure Amiya's Oripathy. I want to change the present state of the Sarkaz.</color>
<color=#000000>I want to walk among this civilization that I helped create, to take in the vitality of new life, something that we once had, but have long since lost.</color>
<color=#000000>Even if...</color>
<color=#000000>Even if everything that we see, all that we know, all that we cherish, no longer exists after a millennium.</color>
